Kereta Wijayakusuma Anjlok di Magetan, PT KAI Usut Penyebab
06 Nov 2019, 01:25 by Nofika Dian Nugroho (Kontributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Madiun - Kereta api Wijayakusuma relasi Banyuwangi – Cilacap yang melintasi jalur selatan anjlok saat hendak masuk Stasiun Barat, Kabupaten Magetan, Jawa Timur, Selasa malam, 5 November 2019. Hingga kini, penyebab kecelakaan ini belum diketahui secara pasti.
“Untuk penyebab kejadian masih dalam pengusutan,” kata Manajer Humas PT Kereta Api Indonesia atau KAI (Persero) Daerah Operasi (Daop) 7 Madiun, Ixfan Hendriwintoko, Selasa, 6 November 2019.
Upaya mencari tahu penyebab terjadinya kecelakaan dengan meminta keterangan kru kereta. Hal itu dilakukan sembari melakukan evakuasi 151 penumpang. Para pengguna jasa layanan kereta api ini diangkut dengan bus untuk melanjutkan perjalanan ke lokasi yang dituju.
“Kami berikan service recovery berupa makanan ringan, serta memberikan layanan pembatalan tiket bagi penumpang yang tidak melanjutkan perjalanan,” Ixfan menjelaskan.
Selain itu, PT KAI melakukan evakuasi bagian moda transportasi massal yang anjlok. Pengangkatan rangkaian ketiga dan keempat untuk kereta penumpang kelas ekonomi dan makan dengan menggunakan Crane Kirow dari Stasiun Solo Balapan.
Ixfan menyatakan anjloknya kereta api Wijayakusuma mengakibatan perjalanan beberapa kereta mengalami keterlambatan. Berdasarkan data, ia menuturkan, kereta itu seperti Matarmaja relasi Malang – Pasar Senen yang terlambat 77 menit.
Selain itu, Mutiara Selatan relasi Bandung – Malang molor 107 menit. Kedua kereta itu tertahan di Stasiun Madiun. Sedangkan kereta Majapahit yang tertahan di Stasiun Caruban mengalami keterlambatan 56 menit. Untuk kereta Malioboro Express tertahan di Stasiun Kedunggalar dengan keterlambatan 58 menit.
Sedangan kereta Gayabaru telat 84 menit dan tertahan di Stasiun Paron. “Kami menyampaikan permohonan maaf atas kejadian tersebut yang mengakibatkan perjalanan menjadi tidak nyaman dan terganggu,” tutur Ixfan.

Wijayakusuma Train Drops in Magetan, PT KAI Investigates Causes
06 Nov 2019, 01:25 by Nofika Dian Nugroho (Contributor), Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Madiun - The Wijayakusuma train, the Banyuwangi - Cilacap relation, which crosses the southern lane dropped when it was about to enter the West Station, Magetan Regency, East Java, Tuesday night, 5 November 2019. Until now, the cause of this accident has not been known with certainty.
"For the cause of the incident is still being investigated," said the Public Relations Manager of PT Kereta Api Indonesia or KAI (Persero) 7 Regional Operations (Daop) Madiun, Ixfan Hendriwintoko, Tuesday, November 6, 2019.
Efforts to find out the cause of the accident by asking for a description of the train crew. This was done while evacuating 151 passengers. Users of these train services are transported by bus to continue the journey to the intended location.
"We provide service recovery in the form of snacks, as well as providing ticket cancellation services for passengers who do not continue their journey," Ixfan explained.
In addition, PT KAI evacuated parts of the mass transportation mode which plummeted. Appointment of the third and fourth circuits for economy class passenger trains and meals using Crane Kirow from Solo Balapan Station.
Ixfan said the plummeting of the Wijayakusuma train resulted in the delays of several trains. Based on the data, he said, the train was like the Matarmaja relation Malang - Pasar Senen which was 77 minutes late.
Besides that, Mutiara Selatan of Bandung - Malang relation was delayed 107 minutes. The two trains are stuck at Madiun Station. While the Majapahit train that was stuck at Caruban Station was delayed by 56 minutes. The Malioboro Express train is stuck at Kedunggalar Station with a delay of 58 minutes.
The Gayabaru train is 84 minutes late and stuck at Paron Station. "We express our apologies for the incident which caused the journey to become uncomfortable and disrupted," said Ixfan.
